title: Sidewall (England or United States), 1880–1900
inscribed: Pattern number 4148 stamped on verso, at end of roll.
description: Stylized chintz-type overall floral design. Printed in two colors. The background is printed deep red with the floral motif being the unprinted red ingrain paper. Each motif is outlined with a fine black line.
justification: Ingrain paper was patented in the United States in 1877. In this process, the paper is dyed in the pulp stage rather than printing the color on the surface. This roll of paper, found in London, is printed on an unusual rich red ground which makes it an interesting addition to the collection. The chintz-style design was one of hundreds of designs based on textile patterns that were produced in the late 19th century.

tombstone.epitaph: Sidewall (England or United States), 1880–1900. machine-printed on ingrain paper. Gift of Brian Coleman. 2000-57-1.
